p: The outcome of esophageal squamous cell carcinoma (ESCC), an aggressive type of neoplasm, has recently been improved in Japan due to advances in multidisciplinary treatments that combine surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy. [ 1– 3] ESCC is a major cause of cancer-related death worldwide, and it frequently recurs in patients with advanced disease, whose prognosis remains poor. [ 1– 5]
